fields.summary: AI/ML: Research and Implement Jira REST APIs for Project Issues Retrieval and CSV Export
fields.description:
*Summary:* {*}{*}The goal is to identify, set up, and use Jira REST APIs to retrieve data for a specific project, sprint, and assignee. The task involves the following steps:

1. Identify API for fetching issues by project, sprint, and assignee; check CSV download option.
2. Implement API if direct CSV export isn't available; retrieve data as JSON. Create Python script to convert JSON to CSV.

worklogs.comment:
1. Explored the Jira REST APIs to get the Issues for a particular project, sprint and assignee which can download the results in the CSV file on the system.
2. Set up the Jira REST API to search the Issues with the JQL query.
3. Set up the REST API for Python. Write Python code to convert the JSON file to a CSV file using pandas.

1. Resolved a field issue in the REST API to ensure required data retrieval for all issues.
2. Optimized Python code to filter API responses according to JQL query. I also filtered out the required fields from the JSON response and converted them into a CSV file.

1. Modify the code to generate a CSV file from the JSON response, creating a separate column for each worklog and formatting the worklog.
2. Worked on summarizing the JIRA ISSUE SUMMARY using the Summary chain in Langchain.

Worked on creating JIRA ISSUE SUMMARY based on two following flows:
1. JIRA SPRINT ISSUES ---> LLM  ---> INTERMEDIATE SUMMARY STRING ---> SUMMARY CHAIN (STUFF) ---> FINAL SUMMARY
2. JIRA SPRINT ISSUES ---> MANUAL FILTERED REQUIRED FIELDS  ---> FILTERED JIRA ISSUES  DOC ---> SUMMARY CHAIN (STUFF) ---> FINAL SUMMARY

1. Write code to convert the JIRA SPRINT ISSUES into a .txt file with proper markdown format and add a document summary explaining the document's structure.
2. Modify the code to execute a bottom-up approach, which generates a summary of each assignee and, based on all those summaries, generates a Team summary.
3. Write code for generating the issue summary using prompt and vector store using embeddings.

{*}Actual result:{*}- Date picker is only get opened while tapping on center of the field not on top of the field in expiry date.

added PR and assigned to QA

*Description:- Getting different biller name in Email notification received for payment confirmation.*

fields.summary: Nickname Screen Compose
fields.description:
Description of requirement
Implement Designs with new components of compose.

Current State
SAV/CHQ Screen - Designs are built in xml layouts so Xml libs are in use.

Expected State
Create screen in compose as future support is in compose only.

Brief rationale for the change
Use Jetpack compose instead of XML since it is modern way to create screens and all new samples and components can only be rendered using jetpack compose.

worklogs.comment: nickname screen UI and checks

Brief rationale for the change

worklogs.comment: UI  implemented in Compose

fields.summary: AI/ML: Implement JavaScript Code for Jira Ticket Summarization Using Langchain.js and Evaluate Forge Integration
fields.description:
*Summary:* 
Develop and test JavaScript code for Jira ticket summarization using {{{}langchain.js{}}}, based on the existing Python logic. The key goals of this ticket include:
 # Writing JavaScript code that replicates the Python-based Jira ticket summarization logic using {{{}langchain.js{}}}.
 # Investigating the steps needed to integrate this JavaScript code into a Forge application.
 # Evaluating if Forge supports {{langchain.js}} and determining any limitations or considerations for running this code within the Forge environment.

worklogs.comment:
1. I worked on converting the whole code for Jira Issue Summarization, written in Python, to javascript using langchain.js.
2. Note down the steps for setting up javascript code and the library installed on the system for javascript code to work fine.

1. Worked on langchain.js and wrote a sample code to generate the SQL query corrensponding to the User Query.
2. Checked Compatibility of code written in javascript using langchain.js with forge app.

fields.summary: AI/ML: Research Existing Jira Apps on the Cloud Marketplace
fields.description:
*Summary:* 
Conduct a comprehensive review of existing Jira apps available on the Jira Cloud Marketplace. The main objectives of this research are:
 # To understand the current capabilities and features of these apps to identify the scope of what can be developed.
 # To determine how far existing solutions have progressed and what functionalities they offer.
 # To explore potential opportunities to leverage existing processes and identify any possible methods for integrating Python code within a Forge app without relying on external servers.

worklogs.comment: Explored Jira apps on the cloud marketplace.

1. Explored how to list the Jira Connect apps on the cloud marketplace as private apps for internal use only.
2. Worked on how to access the private app for internal use only using Access Token.

fields.summary: Android.SDK:- Issue with call back in Paypal and schedule creation issue in T+1.
fields.description:
Issue 1:- Unable to get call back on main SDK screen when tried to add Paypal and paypal credit.

Issue 2:- Unable to create the schedule on for T+1 day.
